intro: Conostylis teretiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal areas. Conostylis teretiuscula plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
